ARABIC: ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِى سَخَّرَ لَكُمُ ٱلْبَحْرَ لِتَجْرِىَ ٱلْفُلْكُ فِيهِ بِأَمْرِهِۦ وَلِتَبْتَغُوا۟ مِن فَضْلِهِۦ وَلَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: It is Allah who has made the sea subservient to you so that the ships sail on it at His command, enabling you to seek His bounty, so that hopefully you will be thankful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: It is God who subjugated the ocean for you so that ships may ply through it by His command, and you may seek His bounty, and may haply be grateful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Allah it is Who has subjected the sea to you so that ships may sail upon it at His bidding and you may seek of His Bounty and give thanks to Him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: God has made the sea subservient to you so that ships sail on by His command and you seek His favors. Perhaps you will be grateful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: It is Allah Who has subjected the sea for you so that ships may sail upon it by His command, and for you to seek His munificence, and so that you may give thanks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Allah, it is He Who has subjected to you the sea, that ships may sail through it by His command, and that you may seek of His bounty, and that you may be thankful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Allah is He Who made subservient to you the sea that the ships may run therein by His command, and that you may seek of His grace, and that you may give thanks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: God is He who has subjected to you the sea, that the ships may run on it at His commandment, and that you may seek His bounty; haply so you will be thankful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Allah it is Who hath made the sea of service unto you that the ships may run thereon by His command, and that ye may seek of His bounty, and that haply ye may be thankful;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: It is God who has subjected the sea to you so that you may sail thereon by His command, and so that you may seek His bounty, and so that you may be grateful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Allah it is Who hath subjected the sea for your sake, that the ships may run thereon by His command and that ye may seek of His grace, and that haply ye may return thanks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: It is Allah who disposed the sea for you[r benefit] so that the ships may sail in it by His command, that you may seek of His bounty and that you may give thanks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: It is Allah Who has subjected the sea to you, that ships may sail through it by His command, that ye may seek of his Bounty, and that ye may be grateful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Allah it is He Who has subjected to you the sea, that ships may sail through it by His Command, and that you may seek of His Bounty, and that you may be thankful,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: It is Allah who has subjected to you the sea so that ships run upon it at His command, and so that you may seek His bounty and be thankful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: It is God who placed the sea at your service, so that ships may run through it by His command, and that you may seek of His bounty, and that you may give thanks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: It is Allah who subjected to you the sea so that ships may sail upon it by His command and that you may seek of His bounty; and perhaps you will be grateful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [45:12] God it is Who disposed for you the sea so that the ships may sail upon it by His command, by His permission, and that you may seek, that you may request, by way of trade, of His bounty, and that perhaps you may give thanks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Allah it is Who hath made the sea of service unto you that the ships may run thereon by His command) by His leave, (and that ye may seek of His bounty) of His provision, (and that haply ye may be thankful) and that you may give thanks for His blessings;
